title: Materials Planning Analyst
content:
Working at Breeze Airways is an exciting endeavor and a serious commitment to bring “The World’s Nicest Airline” to life. We work cross-functionally with truly awesome Team Members to deliver on our mission: “To make the world of travel simple, affordable, and convenient. Improving our guests travel experience using technology, ingenuity and kindness.”Breeze is hiring- join us!
The Material Planning Analyst is part of Breeze’s Technical Supply Chain organization. Responsible for accurately forecasting aircraft spare parts and tools required for scheduled and unscheduled maintenance and allocating them appropriately across the network. This position focusses on optimizing the Total Cost of Ownership while ensuring material availability to help Breeze achieve a low CASM.
Here’s what you’ll do

Work cross-functionally to determine airlines’ inventory needs based on future fleet induction, retirements and changes in maintenance network
Analyze historical consumption data, component reliability, Recommended Spare Part List to determine optimal stocking levels and re-order point to support the airline operations and service levels
Develop inventory forecasting models using power BI, SQL and other advanced analytics tools
Identify key Supply Chain processes that need to be re-designed or enhanced to improve efficiency and accuracy. Work with advanced software tools, such as Microsoft Power Automate, Forms, and Power BI to improve automation and reporting.
Work with Engineering Configuration Control team to set up Part Numbers in ERP system (Trax) and maintain Part Number accuracy (interchangeability, obsolete)
Support Parts and Tools required for Aircraft modification projects
Replenish inventory as required due to Scraps, shelf life expiration, shrinkage etc.
Tooling inventory and calibration management
Ensure inventory accuracy:

Populated Master data with cycle count frequency
Coordinate with warehouse on cycle count
Periodic cleansing of data


Planning for upcoming hard-time removals (slides & rafts, batteries, ELTs, oxygen bottles, O2 generators, life vests)
Plan material needs for aircraft base visits (Heavy Checks)
Support new station start-up
Achieve performance measures and adhere to established standards in conjunction with Breeze Aviation Group Values of Safety, Kindness, Integrity, Ingenuity, and Excellence

Here’s what you need to be successful
Minimum Qualifications

4-year degree in Business, Supply Chain, or related field and/or equivalent experience/training
Familiarity with Power BI or SQL

Preferred Qualifications

Previous supply chain experience in the aviation/airline sector

Skills/Abilities

Exemplifies Breeze’s safety culture, values, and mission
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to work with individuals and teams at all levels in the organization.

Perks of the Job

Health, Vision and Dental
Health Savings Account with Breeze Employee Match
401K with Breeze Employee Match
PTO
Travel on Breeze and other Airlines too!

 Breeze Airways provides equal employment opportunities to all Team Members and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.  This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
Breeze Airways will never request your Social Security Number, Driver’s License or Date of Birth on our job postings. Job Postings requesting any or all of this information should be regarded as a scam. To ensure you are applying to an actual Breeze Airways posting, please apply online at www.flybreeze.com  then click “Careers” at the bottom of the page.
